title: 'Physical threat' from Iran on people living in UK has 'increased significantly', watchdog says
description: The Intelligence and Security Committee says there have been 15 Iran-backed murder or kidnap attempts on UK targets since the beginning of 2022.
content:
The threat of physical attacks by Iran on people living in the UK has increased "significantly" since 2022, according to a new report by parliament's intelligence watchdog.
Iran poses a "wide-ranging, persistent and unpredictable threat" to the UK, a... [4000 chars]

title: Four arrested in connection with M&S and Co-op cyber attacks
description: Three men and one woman - aged between 17 and 20 - have been arrested in London and the Midlands.
content:

title: Children queuing for supplements killed in Israeli strike in Gaza, hospital says
description: Eight children were among 15 people reportedly killed when a queue for nutritional supplements was hit in Deir al-Balah.
content:
At al-Aqsa hospital's mortuary, relatives of those killed wept as they wrapped the dead children in white shrouds and body bags before performing funeral prayers.
One woman told the BBC that her pregnant niece, Manal, and her daughter, Fatima, were a... [2341 chars]

title: Salt Path author Raynor Winn responds to claims she lied about 'true' story
description: A report in The Observer disputes key aspects of the best-selling memoir billed as an "inspiring and life-affirming true story".
content:
Salt Path author Raynor Winn has said claims she lied about her story are "highly misleading" and called suggestions her husband made up his illness "utterly vile".
A report in The Observer disputed key aspects of the hit book, billed as an "inspirin... [4787 chars]

title: Inside the Salt Path controversy: ‘Scandal has stalked memoir since the genre was invented’
description: Raynor Winn’s bestselling book is far from the first time a true story has been called into question after publication. But how does it happen? And should readers really feel betrayed?
content:
“The Salt Path is an unflinchingly honest, inspiring and life-affirming true story,” reads the description of Raynor Winn’s bestselling memoir on its publisher Penguin Random House’s website.
